conbody.p: Create a single polyline entity with multiple line and arc segments by specifying the start and end point of each segment. Options allow you to switch between line and arc segments, apply widths, undo, and close the geometry.

section.title: Methods to create a polyline
section.p: There are three methods to begin creating a polyline:
You can continue adding unlimited segments until you press Enter to end the command.

dlentry.dd: Begin creating a polyline by specifying a start point then:
Specify the next vertex of the polyline.
Additional options: [draw Arcs/Close/Distance/Follow/Halfwidth/Width/Undo]
Begin creating a polyline from the last point picked then:
Specify the next vertex of the polyline.
Additional options: [draw Arcs/Close/Distance/Follow/Halfwidth/Width/Undo]
Begin creating a polyline from the last drawn arc or line segment, following its angle, then:
Specify the length of the segment. Picking a point only determines the length since the angle follows the previous segment.

section.title: Options within the PLINE command
section.p: After you begin creating a polyline, the following options may be available.

dlentry.dd: Specify the end point of the polyline arc segment. The arc is drawn tangent to the previous segment.
Additional options: [draw Lines/Angle/CEnter/Direction/Halfwidth/Radius/Second point/Width]
Specify the included angle of the arc segment then:
Specify the next vertex of the polyline.
Additional options: [Center/Radius]
Specify the center point of the arc segment then:
Specify the next vertex of the polyline.
Additional options: [Angle/Length of chord]
Specify the direction of the arc segment then:
Specify the next vertex of the polyline.
Specify the radius of the arc segment then:
Specify the next vertex of the polyline.
Additional options: [included Angle]
Specify a point along the arc’s circumference.
Specify the end point of the line segment.
Additional options: [draw Arcs/Close/Distance/Follow/Halfwidth/Width/Undo]:
Specify the distance for the line segment then:
Specify the angle of the line segment.
Specify the starting and ending half-width of the segment, as well as all segments that follow -- until you change the width or halfwidth.
The width is saved in the PLINEWID variable.
Specify the starting and ending width of the segment, as well as all segments that follow -- until you change the width or halfwidth.
The width is saved in the PLINEWID variable.
Undo the last polyline segment and continue drawing from its previous start point.
Automatically draw a polyline segment from the end point of the last segment to the start point of the first segment. This ends the command.
